step.context: \text{Which of these is the correct definition \\ of the function?}

step.tex: f(x) \text{ is a straight line for }x\neq 0\\ \text{Hence, it is continuous for all }x\neq 0.\\ \text{But we need to check for continuity \\ at x=0}\\
step.reason: \text{Since, at x=0 the definition of the\\ function changes.Hence x=0 can be \\ the only problem point.So we need to\\ check for continuity at x=0}\\
\text{Since, f(x) is continuous at x}\neq 0(step 2)\\ \therefore\text{ there is no point of discontinuity}

choices.tex: \text{f(x) is discontinuous everywhere in \\ it's domain except 0}
\text{x=0 is the only point of discontinuity}
